keyword: calories in bottle of red wine
title: Calories in a Bottle of Red Wine
meta_description: Discover calories in bottle of red wine: a standard 750 ml dry red has about 625 kcal, plus carbs, alcohol impact, and variations for different types.
h1: Calories in a Bottle of Red Wine
assumptions: Standard 750 ml bottle, dry red wine (e.g., Cabernet Sauvignon), ~13% ABV, no added sugars.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by wine type, alcohol content, sweetness, brand, and serving size. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A standard 750 ml bottle of dry red wine provides about 625 kcal, mostly from alcohol and minimal carbs.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in a bottle of red wine?
faqs.a: About 625 kcal for a standard 750 ml dry red wine.

faqs.q: Does red wine have carbs or sugars?
faqs.a: Dry red wine has low carbs (~6.8 g per bottle) and sugars (~5.3 g), mainly from grapes.

faqs.q: Why are calories high in red wine?
faqs.a: Primarily from alcohol (7 kcal/g); a 13% ABV bottle contributes most of the 625 kcal.

faqs.q: How does wine type affect calories?
faqs.a: Dry reds are lower (~625 kcal); sweeter varieties or ports can add 100-200+ kcal per bottle.

faqs.q: Is red wine healthier than white for calories?
faqs.a: Similar calorie counts; reds may have more antioxidants but calories depend on ABV and sweetness.
